data.text: @jay_salsa Thankfully that’s just a zombie picture I sent to my friend but the mouth colour wasn’t far off 🤣

@DrRachelFloyd Honored to have been screenshotted - wish it had been wrong. I was headed to a creepily empty Euston station and was jarred by how contrastingly beautiful the spring was compared with the situation. Good of you to have followed your instincts despite advice at the time! https://t.co/R4QLWY8Y2w
@DrRachelFloyd Gosh, you really did look rather unwell Rachel…
@peteturton85 @DrTerryGleave I’d also like to think you’d end by singing Pie Jesu in glorious falsetto

@DrRachelFloyd @DrTerryGleave I’d go to the lectern dressed in exactly the same outfit I was wearing in the pictures we plastered Michelle’s wall with, and then solumnly deliver the lyrics to hard rock hallelujah by lordi to a room of your confused friends.
@Stripyfishlady Probably, I feel like I was likely patient zero.

@DrRachelFloyd And a few days later me too! I HAD - up until now - been blaming the student who after a 15 minute meeting in my office said ‘by the way I’ve been coughing a lot, I think I might have coronavirus, what should I do?’ But was it actually you?! https://t.co/tvfWCMGBdF
@DrRachelFloyd Insane it’s only been two years. It feels like FOREVER.

Clearly I was worried enough to leave a password for @DrTerryGleave to access my Programme files if I died. Messenger also reveals an hilarious conversation with @peteturton85 telling me to go to A&E and discussing my eulogy. I often wonder what would have happened if I’d gone.
